task_summary: Detect the T-block and goal marker, approach and align to the block, make contact, then execute repeated pushes toward the fixed goal until the block reaches it; finally retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a planar workspace to a circular goal marker. The robot first ensures both the block and goal are visible, approaches to a safe height, precisely aligns to the block’s side, and gently lowers until contact. It then issues a few incremental pushes in a consistent direction toward the goal, briefly pausing between pushes to stabilize perception. Success is verified by checking the block’s proximity to the goal, after which the robot retreats.
preconditions: T-block and goal marker are present on the table
stepwise_plan: Perceive block and goal (fallback to scanning if not visible)
Move above block and align precisely
Perform several short pushes toward the goal with brief pauses
success_criteria: Block center (or reference point) lies within the goal tolerance
No loss of contact causing unintended motion
failure_and_recovery: If alignment/contact fails: re-align and retry
If block stalls short of goal: repeat push sequence
If overshoot detected: re-approach from opposite side (future extension)
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when IsAt(goal_A) is true and retreat completes.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear contact pose with the end-effector aligned to the T-block’s side; goal marker visible for direction.
frame_3.predicts_next: Push actuation is expected; the following frame should show block displacement toward goal.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Active scan to localize the T-block when not visible.
Active scan to localize goal marker when not visible.
Checks visibility of the goal marker.
Move to a safe height above the T-block.
Planar alignment to the pushing side with tight tolerance.
Lower tool until contact is detected.
Push the block a short distance toward the goal.
Pause to stabilize after each push.
Verify the block is within the goal region.
Back off from the object after completion.

recovery_strategy: Re-align via ApproachAndAlign then repeat pushes
Re-attempt sequence after retreat if verification fails
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and a blue goal ring; instruction colors (gray block, green target) differ—frames were prioritized.
Workspace reference for direction_deg=0 assumed toward the goal marker as seen.

expected_success_criteria: IsAt(goal_A) returns true after push cycles
